intro: Galium hypotrichium subsp. subalpinum, commonly known as the alpine bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically forms dense mats, which help stabilize soil in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. Galium hypotrichium subsp. subalpinum is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas with poor soil conditions.
